column4: hey anyone got time to help me? im tryin to figure out why my xorg.conf file is empty
hey anunnaki, u got any idea why on a fresh install my xorg.conf has no entries
hey , anyone know why /etc/X11/xorg.conf is empty on a fresh install? ive tried dpkg-reconfigure
It's no longer needed, almost everything is detected automagically by X
hmmm that sucks, i need to calibrate my touchscreen
hey Jordan_U any idea how to calibrate a touch screen?
hey so, how can i generate a full xorg.conf file?
, are there any entries in your xorg.conf?
well i want to add settings for my touchscreen
the calibration is a bit off on the top left of my screen

You can probably find some old scripts that will setup an xorg.conf, but why? In one case you are using a script to automatically create a configuration for X, in the other you are letting X automatically configure itself
